paper_title: A compact extension of Journé's $T1$ theorem on product spaces
abstract: We prove a compact version of the $T1$ theorem for bi-parameter singular integrals. That is, if a bi-parameter singular integral $T$ admits compact full and partial kernel representations, and satisfies the weak compactness property, the diagonal $\mathrm{CMO}$ condition, and the product $\mathrm{CMO}$ condition, then $T$ can be extended to a compact operator on $L^p(w)$ for all $1<p<\infty$ and $w \in A_p(\mathbb{R}^{n_1} \times \mathbb{R}^{n_2})$. Even in the unweighted setting, it is the first time to give a compact extension of Journé's $T1$ theorem on product spaces.
publication_venue: In our main theorem, the product $\mathrm{BMO}$ condition was replaced by the product $\mathrm{CMO}$ condition
